result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew R Sawyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.
10 days credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Costs paid in full.  Balance refunded to poster.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.  No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No contact with: Victim or residence.  Domestic Violence counseling.  Maintain employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.  
*After 1 year, Dept. of Corrections may terminate probation as long as defendant complied with all conditions of probation and costs have been paid.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.  Release for treatment, counseling and educational programming.

records.addlTxt: Four treatment/counseling, character reference letters filed on behalf of defendant by Attorney Bailey.

Defendant Andrew R Sawyer in court with attorney Chris Bailey.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

The Defendant was given the following:

WITHHELD SENTENCE;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS; 10 days credit if revoked.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  

*No Use or Possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling. 
*No contact with:  victim or residence.
*Domestic Violence counselingl
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  set at zero.

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation; Apply cash bail, refund balance to poster. 

CONDITION TIME: 60 days with Huber, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Release for treatment, counseling and educational programming. 

Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County. 

AFter 1 year, Dept. of Corrections may terminate probation as long as defendant complied with all conditions of probation and costs have been paid.

Defendant Andrew R Sawyer in court with attorney Chris Bailey.   
Court to Address - State's request for Adjournment.

State presented arguments.
Defense has no objections to an adjournment.

Court Grants - Matter is rescheduled.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Received June 17, 2016 from ADA Lindsey Hirt, requesting adjournment, witness unavailable

Jury status hearing on June 23, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Andrew R Sawyer in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  
Motion filed by the State - For Joinder (of both 14CF1231 & 14CF1349 for trial).
Motion in Limine filed by Defense - Other Acts Evidence.

Motion for Joinder:
State presented arguments to the court.
Defense objects to joinder and presented arguments (matter are not similar, they are separate and distinct).
Response presented.

Court finds/orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds these matters could not have been charged in the same complaint.
They didn't come out of the same set of facts or transaction.
Court is satisfied there is no basis to join these matters for trial.
Therefore, Court denies the State's Motion for Joinder.

Motion for Other Acts Evidence:
Defense presented arguments to the court (testify to prior violent acts of the victim).
State objects and presented arguments to the court (unfairly prejudicial to the victim and the State).
Response presented.


Court finds/orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Court is not satisfied that what the defense is requesting constitutes Other Acts Evidence.
Court Denies - Defense Motion for Other Acts Evidence.
However, they may be permissable under a self-defense basis.
  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
